snippet: Moscow announced a ban on all beef, pork, fish, fruit, vegetables and dairy products from the European Union, the United States, Canada, Australia and Norway.
abstract: Russia retaliates for Western sanctions against Moscow, announcing ban on all beef, pork, fish, fruit, vegetables and dairy products from the European Union, United States, Canada, Australia and Norway for one year; move raises level of confrontation over Ukraine with measures likely to affect Russian consumers at least as much as European farming .

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from Moscow, and Alison Smale from Berlin. Reporting was contributed by James Kanter from Brussels, Maïa de la Baume from Paris, Jack Ewing from Frankfurt, Joanna Berendt from Warsaw, Stephanie Strom from New York, and Christopher F. Schuetze from The Hague. Katarina Johannsen contributed research from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Moscow announced a ban on all beef, pork, fish, fruit, vegetables and dairy products from the European Union, the United States, Canada, Australia and Norway.

headline.main: Russia Responds to Western Sanctions With Import Bans of Its Own
headline.print_headline: Russia Responds to Western Sanctions With Import Bans of Its Own
